strategy_reasoning: This update contains a revert of a major refactor (PR #6155 reverting #6139), which is peak developer relatable trauma. Combining that with the absurdity of Azure forcing specific temperature settings creates a perfect narrative of 'chaotic good' development cycles. High engagement potential from devs who have been there.

images.prompt: A dramatic oil painting in the style of The Death of Socrates, but it's a developer collapsing in a chair while staring at a monitor. The monitor displays red error logs. A heavenly hand reaches down from the clouds pressing a giant keyboard key labeled 'REVERT'. Text floating in the air in gold serif font: 'PR #6155: THE WALK OF SHAME'
images.description: Celebrating the revert of the refactor that broke everything.

images.prompt: A close up of a futuristic industrial control panel. A dial is cranked all the way to the maximum. The dial is labeled 'CREATIVITY'. A sticky note is stuck to it that says 'Azure says keep it at 1'. Cinematic lighting, photorealistic.

A cool cyberpunk robot wearing aviator sunglasses and a tuxedo, holding a globe of the Earth. The robot looks like a pop star. Text overlay in neon pink: 'MR. WORLDWIDE'. Background is a matrix of server racks.
images.description: Gemini 3 Flash moving to global region.

caption:
We refactored the tier system. It broke the docs. We reverted the refactor. Nature is healing. üå±

Code is free. Bugs are free. Fixes are free. Link in bio.
alt_text: Carousel: 1. A dramatic painting of a developer being saved by a Revert button. 2. A dial cranked to max because Azure demands temperature 1. 3. A robot looking like Mr Worldwide representing the global region fix.
